did.head: Overview

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Stanford University. Mathematics and Computational Science Program.

did.unittitle: Stanford University, Mathematical and Computational Science Program, honors theses
did.abstract: Honors theses written by undergraduates in the Stanford University Mathematical and Computer Science Program.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Theses were transferred to the Stanford University Archives from the Hume Writing Center in 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research use; materials must be requested at least 48 hours in advance of intended use. No photocopies may be made.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the creators for materials they have authored or otherwise produced. Transmission or reproduction of materials requires the written permission of the copyright owner.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Stanford University, Mathematical and Computer Science Program (SC4-6536). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of honors theses written by undergraduates in the Stanford University Mathematical and Computer Science Program.

did.unittitle: Mootha, Vamsi K., Applications of data compression techniques to biomolecular sequence analysis.
Lin, David, Novel method for visualizing and modeling the spatial distribution of neural stem cells within intracranial glioma.
